champ.champInfo:
The general management of the competition is carried out by the Branch of the public organization "Ukrainian Federation of Kyokushin Budo Karate Kenbukai" in the Kyiv region. The direct organization and conduct of competitions is entrusted to the management of the Community Branch organization "Ukrainian Federation of Kyokushin Budo Karate Kenbukai" in the Kyiv region, the organizing committee and panel of judges appointed for these competitions.

Organizing committee and judges:

  • The main judge of the competition is the Head of the Ukrainian Federation of Kyokushin Budo Karate Kenbukai in the Kyiv region, the head of the SC "Mamuka Dojo" - Sensei, 3 dan, M. Rudkov
  • Technical support — Tatarchenko I.Yu. (Lviv)

Venue of the competition: Kyiv, str. Volodymyra Brozhka (Kirovohradsk), 17

The competition will be held in Kyiv on February 25, 2024.

Competition program

February 25 (Sunday):

  • 08:00 - 08:30 Registration of all teams, mandate committee in the "kumite" section (weighing of athletes from the team will be selective)
  • 08:30 – 08:50 Jury meeting
  • 09:00 – 09:30 Start of competition, official opening, lining up of all participants
  • 09:30 - 12:30 Matches
  • 12:30 – 13:00 Lunch break
  • 13:30 – 16:00 Continuation of matches
  • 16:00 – 17:00 Awarding of competition winners and prize-winners

Competition rules.

  • Competitions in the "kumite" section are held according to the Olympic system with elimination after defeat
  • The team representative reserves the right to weigh the opponent before the start of the match
  • In case of exceeding the permissible weight error in the category (300g), without taking into account the full equipment (2kg), the athlete is automatically subject to disqualification
  • Athletes who were disqualified during the competition do not participate in the following matches
  • If the athlete does not appear on the tatami after the announcement of his name within 1 minute, the athlete will be considered defeated
  • In the event of controversial issues regarding the results of matches, the final decision is made by the chief judge of the competition
  • The organizer has the right to change (add or combine) weight categories if there is a large number of registered participants or an insufficient number of them

Series B - participants with qualification 0 - 10 kyu.
Series A - participants with qualifications from 9 kyu.

Categories of participants:

Kumite:
Age Gender Weight categories Series
4-5 Guys -20 +20 Series A and B combined
4-5 Girls -20 +20 Series A and B combined
6-7 Young men -20 -25 -30 -35 -40 -50 Series A and B separately
6-7 Girls -25 -30 -40 Series A and B separately
8-9 Young men -25 -30 -35 -40 -45 -55 Series A and B separately
8-9 Girls -25 -30 -35 -45 Series A and B separately
10-11 Young men -30 -35 -40 -45 -50 -60 Series A and B separately
10-11 Girls -35 -40 -45 -55 Series A and B separately
12-13 Young men -40 -45 -50 -55 -60 -70 Series A and B separately
12-13 Girls -40 -45 -50 -60 Series A and B separately
14-15 Young men -45 -50 -55 -60 -65 -80 Series A and B combined
14-15 Girls -50 -55 -60 -75 Series A and B combined
16-17 Young men -55 -60 -65 -70 -75 -90 Series A and B combined
16-17 Girls -50 -55 -60 -75 Series A and B combined
Scheme of matches
  • Children: boys and girls (5-9 years):
    • qualifying matches - 1 min. + 1 min with a mandatory solution
    • Semifinal and final matches: 1 min. + 1 min. + weighing + 1 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • Children: boys and girls (10-11 years old):
    • Qualifying matches: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. with a binding decision
    • Semifinal and final matches: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.5 min. (The difference in weight is 2 kg)
  • Children: boys and girls (12-13 years old):
    • qualifying matches - Qualifying matches: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. with a binding decision
    • Semifinal and final matches: 1.5 min. + 1.5 min. + weighing + 1.5 min. (The difference in weight is 3 kg)
  • Boys and girls (14-17 years old):
    • qualifying matches - Qualifying matches: 2 min. + 2 min. with a binding decision
    • Semifinal and final matches: 2 min. + 2 min. + weighing + 2 min. (The difference in weight is 3 kg)

Conditions of participation

Competition - 3rd Kyokushin Budo Karate Kenbukai Open Tournament "Way of the Warrior" has regional status. Representatives of teams from various Kyokushin karate federations are expected to participate and cities of Ukraine. The number of athletes in the "kumite" section that one organization has the right to exhibit, no limited Each team is obliged to provide at least 1 judge to the composition of the panel of judges under the condition prior agreement with the Chief Judge of the competition.Please note that in this tournament the organizer, at its own discretion, has the right to reduce the number of side judges, if necessary a situation with an insufficient number of declared referees. During fights, only 1 person is allowed to lead a fighter into battle - a trainer or team representative

Awards

  • Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded cups, medals, diplomas of relevant degrees

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until February 18, 2024.

Organizer - Mamuka Rudkov
tel. 09761134 33

Responsible for receiving teams (transfer, settlement) - Viktoria Chernova
tel. 0678390881

Questions regarding preliminary applications and registration of participants - Ihor Tatarchenko
tel. 0677887728

Financial expenses

Expenses for the organization and conduct of the competition, expenses related to the food of the judges boards and the purchase of award paraphernalia are provided by the Branch of the public organization "Ukrainian Federation of Kyokushin Budo Karate Kenbukai" in the Kyiv region. The work of judges is paid by the organizer of the tournament! Travel expenses in both directions, accommodation, meals, daily expenses of trainers and participants of the competition are provided by organizations that send them
